speaker: Fens Hut
line: A hut on stilts trembles above dark water. Windchimes made of bottle-glass sing in a pattern that feels almost deliberate.

speaker: Healer Tamsin
line: Boots off. Words soft. The mire doesn’t like being insulted.

speaker: Healer Tamsin
line: Everyone wants directions. Few want the truth: the mire moves. If you can’t read it, you’ll walk until you’re too tired to care where you end up.

speaker: Healer Tamsin
line: If you cross at Fenmire Crossing, pay the toll with something you can afford to lose. Don’t offer your anger. It comes back hungry.

speaker: Healer Tamsin
line: Missing folk? Some vanish into water. Some vanish into bargains. If you find proof of the second kind, bring it to me—quietly.

speaker: Healer Tamsin
line: I can’t mend what the Hollow takes. But I can keep you standing long enough to make your own choices.

speaker: Fens Hut
line: As you leave, the glass chimes shift. For a moment, the song sounds like a warning spoken gently.
